chapterTitle: Financial Statements, Taxes, and Cash Flow

columns.text: This exercise requires us to compute the net income and operating cash flow of Raines Umbrella Corp. and explain the results.

Let's first define cash flow to net income and operating cash flow.

- **Net income** is the business income after subtracting all of its expenses for the period.

- **Operating Cash Flow** measures the amount of cash generated by a company's normal business operation.

### a. Net income for 2018

To calculate the net income of the company, we can prepare an income statement using the following information in the problem:

| |Amounts ($) | 
|--|--:| 
|Sales |705,000 | 
|Cost of goods sold |445,000 | 
|Administrative and Selling Expense | 95,000| 
| Depreciation Expense|140,000 | 
| Interest Expense|70,000 |

The tax rate is 25%.

In preparing an income statement, it is important to use this formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Net Income} &= \text{Sales} - {\text{Expenses}}\\[1pt]
\end{aligned}$$

The income statement presents different stages such as gross profit, earnings before taxes, taxable income and net income.

Now, we can compute the net income for 2018 using the presented income statement below:

$$\def\arraystretch{1.2} 
\begin{array}{|c|} \hline 
\textbf{Raines Umbrella Corp.}\\ 
\text{Income Statement Before Tax}\\ 
\text{For the year ended December 31, 2018}\\ \hline 
\begin{array}{l r r }\\ \text{Sales} & \$705,000 &\\ 
\text{Less: Cost of Sales} & \underline{445,000} & \\ 
\textbf{Gross Profit} & \$260,000\\ 
\text{Less: Administrative and Selling Expense} &{\text95,000} &\\ 
\text{Less: Depreciation} & \underline{\quad140,000} &\\ 
\textbf{Earnings before interest and taxes} & \$25,000\\ 
\text{Interest Expense} & \underline{70,000}\\ 
\textbf{Taxable income} & {{\mathbf{-\$45,000}}}\\ 
\text{Tax Expense} & \underline{\hspace{25pt}0}\\ 
\textbf{Net income} & \underline{\underline{\mathbf{-\$45,000}}}\\ \end{array}\\\\ \hline 
\end{array}$$

Therefore, the net income for 2018 of Raines Umbrella Corp. is **-$45,000**.

### b. Operating Cash Flow

Operating Cash Flow is computed as follows:

$$\begin{aligned} \text{Operating Cash Flow} &= \text{EBIT} + {\text{Depreciation}} - {\text{Taxes}}\\[1pt] \end{aligned}$$
â€‹

Now that we have computed the EBIT in step, let's now compute for the operating cash flow using the equation in step 6.

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{Operating Cash Flow} &= \text{EBIT} + {\text{Depreciation}} - {\text{Taxes}}\\[5pt] 
&= \text{\$25,000} + {\text{140,000}} - {\text{0}}\\[5pt] 
&= \underline{\underline{\textbf{\$165,000}}} 
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the operating cash flow of Square Hammer Corp. is **$165,000**.

### c. Explain your results in (a) and (b).

The company's net income is negative because the company's total expenses exceed the sales earned. The company's operating cash flow is positive since the depreciation is added back as a non-cash expense.
